Motion

First week

  • Reading
    • ‘The Paradoxes of Motion and the Possibility of Change’, pp. 288-297 E.J. Lowe, A Survey of Metaphysics
    • Physics, Book 6, Aristotle
    • ‘A Contemporary Look at Zeno’s Paradoxes: an Excerpt from Space, Time, and Motion’, Wesley C. Salmon. NB: the article is chapter 15 of this linked to book.
  • Videos
    • Open University Presentation
    • TedED on Dichotomoy Paradox
    • BBC Four Long Discussion
  • Notes
    • Handout 1
    • Handout 2

Second week

  • Reading
    • ‘The Paradoxes of Motion and the Possibility of Change’, pp. 300-306 E.J. Lowe, ‘A Survey of Metaphysics’, OUP, 2002
    • ‘Zeno’s Paradoxes’, SEP entry (optional).
    • ‘Infinity and Metaphysics’, D. Nolan (optional).
    • ‘The Cinematic Universe’, R. Le Poidevin (optional).
  • Videos
    • Angie Hobbs on the Arrow Paradox
  • Notes
    • Handout

Assignments

  • Short Essay
